content.rendered:
In order to have safer roads, people need to practice safer driving. Through decades of advertisements and public information, we have become more aware while on the roads, but even with lower auto accidents over the years, many still occur in the United States. Check out these tips on how to become a safer driver.

Don’t Speed

According to the NHTSA, the consequences of driving fast contribute to traffic crashes and increase your crash risk by as much as 50 percent. Take your time while driving, obey the speed limits, and leave earlier if you have somewhere to be.

Avoid Distractions

Any phone call or text message can wait until you are off the road and if not, either pull over or use a hands-free device. In addition to cell phone distractions, make sure you aren’t eating, applying makeup, or even turning around to interact with other passengers in the car. When you are behind the driver’s wheel, stay focused on the road and the other cars around you.

Keep Your Vehicle Safe

Make sure you are keeping your car maintenance in check and address any issues your vehicle may have. Check on your car tire pressure as this is one of the most common car problems you will face, and make sure you are keeping up to date on any recalls. If you need new auto parts in Chicago, tend to that immediately to keep your car in tip-top shape.
Everyone should always practice safe driving on the road, but at the end of the day, you can only take care of yourself. Stay safe, follow these tips, and if you need auto parts in Chicago to make your car run better, stop by Aero Auto Parts today.
